class.name: AudioStreamWithEffects
class.brief_description: Applies effects to an audio stream.
class.description: An [AudioStreamWithEffects] is an audio stream that can apply one or more [AudioEffect]s to the assigned [member stream]. The effects are applied in the order in which they are listed. All methods with index arguments support negative indices, i.e. [code]-1[/code] to access the last item, [code]-2[/code] to select the second-to-last item, and so on. [b]Note:[/b] Different effects can require vastly different amounts of processing power. Be mindful of how many intensive effects, such as reverb and delay, can be processing at once.

method.name: add_effect
method.description: Adds an effect at the specified index. If [param index] is negative, the effect will be added from the end ([code]-1[/code] adds a new effect to the end, [code]-2[/code] adds a new effect to the second-to-last position, and so on.)

method.name: get_effect
method.description: Returns the audio effect at the specified index.

method.name: get_effect_bypass_enabled
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if the audio effect at the specified index is currently bypassed.

method.name: move_effect
method.description: Moves an effect by copying it from [param index_from], inserting it at [param index_to], and removing it at the original index. [param index_to] can be equal to [member effect_count] to move an effect to the end. Negative values of [param index_to] access indices relative to the end, with [code]-1[/code] moving the effect to the end, [code]-2[/code] moving it to the second-to-last position, and so on. [b]Note:[/b] Due to the way elements are moved, if [param index_to] is greater than [param index_from], the final index of the moved item will be one less than [param index_to].

method.name: remove_effect
method.description: Removes the effect at the specified index.

method.name: set_effect
method.description: Sets the audio effect at the specified index.

method.name: set_effect_bypass_enabled
method.description: Sets bypass on the effect at the specified index to [param enabled]. Bypassing an effect disables the effect's influence on the sound, essentially turning it off.

members.member: The number of effects added to this audio stream.
The audio stream resource to play and apply effects to.
The volume curve to apply to the tail as it fades out. Set to a low value such as [code]0.0001[/code] to mimic a hard cut when the tail ends.
The amount of time, in seconds, to wait after the child stream stops before stopping this stream. Useful for letting effects such as reverb ring out.
